line.en: 'In the end, we did it 3 more times.'
'Normal people don't do it this much on their\nfirst time, right?'
After the first time, we ended up doing it not\nonce, but twice more.
Asa kept on demanding to keep going.
'Was I...really annoying?'
'No, not at all. Although I am a bit tired.'
'I-Is that right. That's good then.'
I went overboard and killed all my muscles.\nTomorrow it'll probably start to hurt...
'I hope I can still walk normally tomorrow...'
'Y-yeah...!'
'Hm? What's wrong, Senpai?'
'N-nothing, just that... now that it's over and\nI'm looking at you properly, I've realized...'
'You are... really cute when you are naked.'
'Ahh...S-Senpai, that's embarassing...'
'L-let's do it lots from now on. I, umm...'
'I think I'd like to have sex a great deal.'
'A-anyway I'll go put some clothes on!'
'Me too!'
'...And with that, it's done!'
'Alriiiiiiight!'
Ageha was shouting for joy.
It was finally, finally finished.
Our remodelled glider!
'Congratulations, everyone! We've finally made it\nthis far!'
'... (sniff)'
'Hey there, it's a little too early to start\ncrying, isn't it? We haven't even flown it yet!'
'But... But...!'
'Kotori, you're being too emotional.'
'Uwaaaah!'
'Aah, it's too bad Amane couldn't come today. She\nshould have just skipped work and joined us.'
'You know she can't do that. She's not a student\nanymore.'
It's true that we all wished she could have seen\nthe moment the glider was finished, though.
'...But anyway, tomorrow's the day...'
That's right. Tomorrow was the day of the test\nflight.
Naturally, we kept working to finish all the\npreparations.
'...It should fly now, right?'
'I think we'll still have to make some\nadjustments after we see how it works during the\ntest.'
'...(sigh)... I never was very helpful during all\nof this.'
'Huh?'
'I just mean, you all helped me out so much, but\nI don't feel like I've really done much to help\nat all.'
'What? Are you still going on about that?'
'Thanks to you, Yoru helped us out, and everyone\nwas more motivated. The whole club brightened up\nbecause of you.'
'I think that's really important.'
'I've made things uncomfortable in the past, so I\nappreciate someone who does the opposite.'
'I also think that your help is half the reason\nwe've made it this far, Asa.'
'B-but... I've done nothing but cause trouble!'
'...You really don't get it, Asa.'
'You're so cute whenever you do that that\neveryone gets worried about you, so we all worked\nharder than ever for your sake.'
'Young people exist to make trouble for their\nelders, and that's just fine!'
'That's right, and that's what gives us the\nmotivation to work harder. It's things like that\nthat make this all so fun.'
'Asa, you're this club's mascot! We couldn't do\nit without you!'
'Mascot?!'
Mascot... Somehow I think that's not quite right.
But it looked like everyone felt the same way\nthat Yoru and I did about Asa.
'That's right, Sis.'
'Yoru...'
'A genius could never be a mascot because they're\nnot cute enough, but you're cute.'
'That doesn't feel like you're complimenting me!'
'Yeah, Asa's so cute!'
We weren't just flattering her.
Asa was trying as hard as she could, in her own\nway.
And that was definitely a positive influence on\nthe club.
It meant we had friends helping us. We could feel\ncomfortable knowing we had friends both older and\nyounger, working together to build something.
'...Thank you...'
'Aoi has really been making me feel better\nlately... But I was still a little worried.'
'I thought I wasn't really being helpful at all.'
'I'm not good with machines like Ageha, and I'm\nnot smart like Kotori and Yoru, and I can't fly\nthe plane like Aoi...'
'So I felt like I was just tagging along with\nthis club, sharing your dream without helping...'
'I still feel like that.'
'Asa.'
'But I'm so happy... about what you all said.'
'...Well, that's how it is, Asa.'
'Whenever you feel uneasy or worried, or like you\ndon't understand yourself...'
'Just remember Soaring.'
'Don't you trust me and Kanako, Kotori and Ageha,\nor even Yoru?'
'Huh? Why would you think...?'
'Then you shouldn't think we're all wrong. If you\ntrust us, and we say it's okay, then it's really\nokay!'
'Just remember that, alright?'
'We can't compare to a boyfriend.'
'He's definitely cheesier than us.'
'Shut up! Anyway, that's how it is.'
'Okay!'
After that, we made plans for the next day's test\nflight, and then just let ourselves feel happy\nabout the completion of the glider.
It was the end of our long plan to remodel the\nglider, and the start of our flight plan.
Kotori, Ageha, Kanako and Asa all left to pray at\nthe shrine for the glider's success.
I was practicing by myself on the simulator,\ngetting ready for tomorrow.
'I'm kinda tired, so I'll take a break.'
I went outside to look up at Windmill Hill.
But someone was there before me.
'Hello.'
'Oh, Yoru. I thought you'd gone home.'

Asa and the others had invited Yoru to go with
them, but she'd said it was too much of a bother.
Since there was nothing left to do at the club,
she left.
'I never said I was going straight home. I've\nbeen watching the windmills.'
'Or am I not allowed to be sentimental\nsometimes?'
'No, I never said that...'
Sentimental, huh?
I'll admit that I'd never thought Yoru was the\nsentimental type.
'...Thank you.'
'Huh?'
'Sis has been really happy lately. She's\nregaining her confidence too. I think she's\nbecome more optimistic than before.'
'Aah... Yeah. Thank you as well, for sharing her\nhappiness with me.'
'I'm glad to hear you say that.'
'We've talked about this before, but Asa really\nis an optimist. I feel cheerful when I'm around\nher. And she's so cute.'
'She's our mascot, after all.'
'Yeah, our mascot!'
'...I could never do that.'
'You said that earlier too.'
'I'm no good at comforting people. So I could\nnever be like her.'
'I'm... the type who just keeps on running.'
The type who just keeps on running.
Yoru might be right.
'After all, I'm a genius.'
'Geniuses have to keep on going, so they can set\na goal for someone else.'
'Sis was jealous of me, right? I've got to be\nsomeone worth being jealous of.'
'That's how I see it.'
'I'll keep building the road for Sis to aim for.\nI'm going to be successful. I'll do something\nbig. And then I'll find my...'
'Yoru?'
Yoru was gazing somewhere far away.
She looked somehow lonely.
'Anyway... I'm going to do something big.'
'And then you'll regret turning me down.'
'What are you talking about?'
Her tone was a little sharp.
Her words stung a little.
'I'm being sarcastic. Because you rejected me.'
'...I-I'm sorry...'
'Don't apologize. It hurts.'
'Then what should I do?'
'Who knows...'
'Whaaa..?'
'Hee hee hee! I'm never gonna stop teasing you\nabout that!'
'Eeehhhh...'
Apparently Yoru was also the type to hold a\ngrudge.
'...But it's almost time, isn't it?'
'Hmm?'
'For the flight. It makes it feel worth it to\nwork so hard up until now, doesn't it?'
'Huh? Yoru, are you cheering me on?'
'Is there something wrong with that?'
'No, it's not that...'
'I just have a vague hope that it'll work. It\nlooks like your enthusiasm has rubbed off on me.'
'...Thank you. I'm happy you're cheering us on.'
'Then you'd better do your best to make sure it\ndoesn't fall.'
'Yeah.'
'Aoi, I have a favor to ask.'
'What is it?'
'At the test flight. Can you let Asa ride?'
'I've always intended to. If she wants to,\nanyway.'
We weren't limited to only one test flight, after\nall.
I thought we'd each give it a try.
'Okay, good. Thank you.'
'...You really do care about your sister, don't\nyou, Yoru?'
Even the favor she had to ask about the test\nflight was really about her sister.
'You can ride it too if you want.'
'I'm not interested.'
'...Really?'
Yoru wasn't always completely straightforward.
'But I think Sis should fly.'
'...She should fly?'
'Yes, she should. So I'm counting on you.'
'...Okay, got it. Leave it to me.'
'And I'm counting on you not to let her fall.'
'She won't fall. I don't plan to be careless.'
'Okay, alright then.'
'...People dream of becoming like birds, but to\nbirds, flying is something they can take for\ngranted. So I think that's enough.'
'If a human who usually crawls on the ground can\nfly, that itself has value.'
'Aoi, I'm rinsing these for you now.'
'Thanks. And it'd be a big help if you could wash\noff the burdock root as well.'
'Ah, in that case, can I try cutting the burdock\ntoo? You want it sliced thin, right?'
'Sure, thanks. It's not too hard if you don't\noverstrain yourself.'
'Alright!'
After dinner, when everyone else had gone back to\ntheir rooms, Asa and I were cooking again. We\nwere making tomorrow's breakfast.
We'd have to get up early for the test flight, so\nwe wanted to finish all the cooking the night\nbefore.

All of us in Soaring had decided to pack our
breakfasts up and eat them together when we'd
arrived, rather than getting up even earlier to
eat at home.
As for the other dorm residents, we prepared\ntheir breakfasts so that they'd only have to\nreheat them themselves.
'You've really gotten better at cooking lately,\nAsa. You're a really big help in the kitchen.'
'Well, I'm supposed to be your partner, Aoi!'
'...That makes me really happy. I'm depending on\nyou.'
'Heh heh.'
Asa gave me a carefree smile.
Aaah, she really is just too cute.
'Alright, let's really go for it and make some\ngreat breakfasts, Aoi! I'm sure we'll fly even\nbetter if we've eaten good food first!'
'You're really into this, Asa.'
'Of course I am! After all, it's going to fly in\nthe sky!'
'And you are too, Asa.'
'Huh?'
'We're planning to let you ride during the test\nflight, too.'
'Really? Can I really ride too?'
Asa looked surprised.
'It's a test, so we can send it up as many times\nas we like. You really should give it a try.\nDon't you want to?'
'Y...yes! If I can, then I definitely want to\nride it! I...I just thought I'd only be watching\nit...'
'Wow... Can I really, really ride it?!'
'As long as there's no problem that makes us\ncancel the test, it's okay. Let's fly together!'
'Unnh...'
'Huh? Why are you crying?!'
'No, it's just, I'm happy...'
As she spoke, the tears overflowed onto Asa's\ncheeks.
'...You are such a crybaby, Asa.'
'But... I'm so happy! To think that I can really\nfly in the sky...'
'I've always wanted to. To fly in that sky...'
'You told me that once.'
'...Yes. And so, to think that I can actually do\nit... Of course I'm happy...'
'If you're so happy just thinking about it, then\nyou've definitely got to fly tomorrow.'
...Whew...
I left the dorm to cool off a bit outside.
And there I saw Kanako.
'Oh, it's Aoi!'
'...Even outside, Kanako? Seriously...?'
'Don't worry! Nobody weird is gonna show up here\nanyway.'
'It's not likely, but it'd really be a problem if\nanyone did show up, so please cut it out.'
'Aah, wait a minute Aoi, are you jealous? I see.\nYou don't want anyone else to see me in my\nunderwear.'
'I think I'm a little... happy?'
'...Sure, think what you want, but just stop\ndoing it, okay? I'm begging you.'
This was really turning into a pain, so I just\nanswered with what she wanted to hear.
'It seems to be going along well.'
'Huh?'
'With Asa.'
'Yeah, it is. ...At least for me. I really love\nher.'
'Uwaahh... Go die, okay?'
'That was so cheesy I need some perfume to get\nrid of the stink! It's tough being a single\ngirl...'
'You're the one who brought up the subject.'

'I guess you're right. It's my own fault. I
should have realized that if I talked to you
about Asa, you'd go ahead and say something so
embarrassing I'd want to die.'
Is that really the way I talked about her?
'But... I'm glad that it's going so well. It's\nquite a relief, as an older sister figure.'
'...You've really been watching out for those\ntwo, haven't you, Kanako?'
'Well, after all, I was the one who got them to\nswitch places, so I'm a bit at fault for anything\nthat happened because of that.'
'So I feel a bit responsible.'
'Ahaha, I see.'
Now that she mentioned it, that was true.
It had actually happened fairly recently, but it\nfelt like ages ago.
It must be because the days since then had been\nso memorable themselves.
So many things were changing, with the club, and\nwith Asa.
'I'd wanted a second chance. I told you that,\nright? With Asa and Yoru.'
'Because you messed up with Kotori, right?'
Yeah, she'd talked to me about that before.
Because she hadn't gotten along well with Kotori,\nshe'd promised herself to do better with Asa and\nYoru.
'But despite it all, it seems you're the one who\ncaptured their hearts, which is a little hard on\nme.'
'Eh? I never meant to...'
'You're like a con man, Aoi.'
'But thanks to you taking care of them, Kanako,\nthey finally opened up to us... So it's not just\nme.'
Not only Asa, but even Yoru had become so much\ncloser to us, thanks to Soaring Club.
That was thanks to everyone, and Kanako had taken\nthe initiative to make it happen.
'...And my heart too.'
'Eeeh?!'
Did Kanako just whisper what I thought she did?
Kanako's heart too? Ummm... Did she mean...?
'Nothing. It was just a joke.'
'...Don't startle me like that. I'm already a bit\nshaken lately by so many new things.'
'You're so popular, Aoi.'
'I'm jealous!'
First Yoru was teasing me, and now Kanako.
This was turning into a rough day...
'I don't handle it well when people don't like\nme.'
'Hmm? You, Kanako?'
'Yeah. So I'm scared of getting too close to\npeople. And when I think someone might actually\nlike me, it's even scarier.'
'You don't seem that way. I've always thought you\nwere really good at talking to people.'
She seemed to have great social skills.
'I think that's what I'm naturally like. But\nthat's the problem.'
'I always approach people like this, but one\ntime... I was cut off.'
'...You were?'

'Yeah. I guess I was acting too familiar with
everyone or something. All the girls in my class
started looking really irritated at me, and then
avoiding me.'
'It was a really long time ago, but it was really\ntraumatizing.'
'I see...'
That was a past that I'd never have guessed at,\nknowing Kanako now.

'So I'm scared to get close to anyone unless I'm
absolutely positive that they like me. I keep
worrying that they'll start hating me, like that
one time.'
'And so even if I seemed really familiar with\neveryone, I was still drawing a line somewhere,\nand even when I acted close,'
'I was being careful not to let myself get too\nclose. It was the same with Kotori... You see?'
...I see.
It wasn't that Kotori and Kanako had been\npurposefully excluding each other.
'But I've come to see that that's not a very good\nway to be. Looking at you has showed me that.'
'...I realized that I'd always wanted to be close\nwith Kotori like you were, and that I just\ncouldn't make myself do it.'
'...Kanako...'
'It was sad. It felt like I'd lost to myself. I\nwas frightened because of one mistake. I'd put\nthe breaks on my own social life. So...'
'Now that I'm getting along with everyone here,\nand I'm really really happy.'
I really understood what Kanako was saying.
'And that's why. That's why I'm cheering Asa and\nYoru on.'
'Yeah. I'm sure she's felt the same way.'
'What do you mean?'
'...I don't know what it was that made Asa so\ncritical of herself all the time...'
'But I want her to fly in the sky, and be proud\nof herself. After all, even I got my second\nchance.'
'So I want her to feel that satisfaction too.'
'...Kanako...'
A second chance.

Asa always got depressed over her own
inadequacies, and got jealous of those around
her. She would probably understand Kanako's
feelings.
'...Wow, now I'm getting cheesy!'
'Don't tease about it. You really said something\ncool there.'
'Heh heh! It's no good. I'm really bad at being\nserious!'
'I was so moved and everything...'
'If I get too serious, I'm not even being myself,\nright? That's right. Let's leave it at that. Heh\nheh...'
Kanako gave an embarrassed smile and desperately\ntried to pass off her impassioned speech as a\njoke.
She always seemed so carefree, but it looked as\nthough deep down she was a really serious\nperson...
'Well then, I'll be getting back to my room.\nGoing to do some prepping for tomorrow and get in\nthe shower.'
'Eh? You get in the shower to prepare for\ntomorrow? normally you do the opposite don't\nyou?'
'Ah, um...well...'
I got stuck on what to say.
'Something's strange...'
'Aha, ahaha... there's some stuff I got to do! So\ndon't worry about it!'
'Yes, something strange.'
'A-anyway, I'm going back to my room now!'
That's right. It's because I have a promise.
'Senpai, I'm here.'
Asa came into my room.
She had some bathing stuff and a change of\nclothes in her hand.
'Then let's get going. If we don't go in soon,\nwe'll have no time left for sleep.'
'Yeah.'
I opened the door to the shower room.
'W-wait. Perhaps it's a better idea if we don't\nboth go in at the same time? Someone might see\nus...'
'T-that's true. Then what about I go in first?'
'Umm, yes please. And then we will rendezvous in\nthe shower room.'
'O-okay! I'll wait for you then!'
She said, as she once again fled out the room.
...in fact, it might be a good idea if we don't\nexit at the same time as well.
Our promise.
Our promise was to take a shower together.
Incidentally, the person who proposed it was Asa\nherself.
But if the others find out we will be in big\ntrouble.
Considering I am the keeper of this building, I\ncan't do things that upset the legitimacy of my\njob.
'...but, if it's Asa inviting me to the shower \m\nhow can I decline?'
I say it out loud, not that anyone's listening
Yes, that's right. There is no way I can decline.
Anyway.
About time I go.
